newsitem.title: USA: American Gaming sues President Casino unit.
newsitem.headline: American Gaming sues President Casino unit.

text.p: American Gaming & Entertainment Ltd on Thursday said it has commenced litigation against two units of President Casino Inc.

The suit was filed in the Chancery Court of Harrison County, Miss., Second Judicial District against President Mississippi Charter Corp, or PMCC, and President Riverboat Casino - Mississippi Inc, or PRCM.
It charges that PMCC has refused to comply with an agreement to hire and charter the "Gold Coast Casino" barge from American Gaming for about $329,000 per month through June 18, 2000.

American Gaming said it has alleged that PMCC has not made the October 1996 through January 1997 payments under their agreement in full and has not made the required charter payments since such time. The unpaid charter payments total about $1.97 million, it claimed.
The company said it is seeking that PMCC and PRCM comply with the agreement and make the back payments. It is alternatively seeking a judgment against PMCC and PRCM of $23.4 million.
A spokeswoman for President Casinos was not immediately available for comment on the suit.
